Comment 1: 
My 2Â¢.

http.NewRequest already sets ProtoMajor/ProtoMinor to 1, and http.ReadRequest populates
those fields, so I'm guessing you were constructing the HTTP Request manually.

I'm wary of special-casing 0,0 in one place that would otherwise be a simple convenience
wrapper. I don't have an alternative that would have made your life easier, but here are
some weak ideas that come to mind:
  - a method on http.Request that tells you whether it's valid
  - a method on http.Request that fills in its default values (but that's what http.NewRequest already does)
  - log a message in ProtoAtLeast if it's 0,0

I tend to look at the type definition if I'm writing out a composite literal, and make
sure to fill in relevant fields in that order. Maybe this is one of those cases where
programmer habit is better than programmatic enforcement.
